attributes.information: The right atrium is one of the four chambers of the heart. It receives deoxygenated blood from the body through the superior and inferior vena cava and pumps it into the right ventricle, which then sends it to the lungs for oxygenation.
attributes.title: Right Atrium
Right Ventricle
attributes.information: The right ventricle is the heart chamber that receives deoxygenated blood from the right atrium. It pumps this blood into the pulmonary arteries, which carry it to the lungs for oxygenation.

attributes.title: Left Atrium
attributes.information: The left atrium is the heart chamber that receives oxygenated blood from the lungs through the pulmonary veins. It then pumps this blood into the left ventricle, which distributes it to the rest of the body.

attributes.title: Left Ventricle
attributes.information: The left ventricle is the heart's strongest chamber. It gets oxygen-rich blood from the left atrium and pumps it to the body through the aorta. It has thick walls to create strong pressure for the blood to reach all parts of the body.
